page.title: 11THE POST OFFICE EAST CARLTON
page.content: Mrs Hubbard runs the Post Office in a Council house where she has lived with her husband since 1965.They have converted a toilet and coal cellar into the shop. They sell essentials such as goceries & fire making sticks as well as sweets & cigarettes.They do not sell newspapers as these are delivered from Wilbarston. Most sales are of 17p and 13p postage stamps. On Thursday mornings,the old age pensioners are paid and the shop is very busy.Tuesday is family allowance day,and some unemployment benefit is also paid. Villagers use the notice board outside the shop for details of village events. It is a very important place for this small village.
